meta.description: Deep dive into FD, RD, Mutual Funds, and Corporate FDs focusing on taxation, DICGC safety, hidden commissions, and exit loads.

fee_decoder.name: The ₹5 Lakh Safety Limit
fee_decoder.insight: Bank deposits are insured by DICGC only up to ₹5 Lakh per bank per user (Principal + Interest). If a Co-operative bank fails, you lose anything above ₹5 Lakh.
fee_decoder.action: Split deposits > ₹5 Lakh across different banks (e.g., SBI, HDFC, ICICI) to stay fully insured.

fee_decoder.name: Premature Withdrawal Penalty
fee_decoder.insight: If you break an FD before maturity, banks deduct 1% from the *applicable* rate (rate for the period FD actually ran), not just the contracted rate.
fee_decoder.action: Avoid breaking FDs. Use a 'Loan Against FD' or Overdraft (usually 1-2% interest above FD rate).

fee_decoder.name: Corporate FDs
fee_decoder.insight: Company FDs (like Shriram, Bajaj) offer higher rates but are UNSECURED. DICGC insurance does NOT apply. If the company defaults, you lose 100%.
fee_decoder.action: Stick to AAA-rated Corporate FDs only. Never chase the highest rate.

fee_decoder.name: RD Delayed Installment
fee_decoder.insight: Missing an RD date is expensive. Banks charge a penalty for every day/month of delay and may reduce the final interest payout.
fee_decoder.action: Set the RD deduction date 2-3 days *after* your salary date.

fee_decoder.name: Form 15G/15H Reality
fee_decoder.insight: Submitting 15G stops TDS deduction (10%), but it does NOT make the interest tax-free. You still have to pay tax if your total income exceeds the basic exemption limit.
fee_decoder.action: Check your total tax liability before submitting 15G to avoid penalties.

smart_checks.explanation: Auto-sweep gives FD returns on savings balance. But if the sweep is broken (money used) within 7 days, you often earn ZERO interest on that chunk.
smart_checks.recommendation: Keep a buffer in savings. Let only true surplus go to Auto-Sweep.

smart_checks.explanation: Banks often auto-renew FDs for the same tenure. If rates have dropped, you get locked into a lower rate automatically.
smart_checks.recommendation: Set maturity instruction to 'Auto-Credit to Savings Account' so you can decide the best new tenure manually.

smart_checks.term: Mode of Operation: Either or Survivor
smart_checks.explanation: If holding is 'Jointly', both signatures are needed for everything. In 'E or S', either survivor can manage it easily.
smart_checks.recommendation: Always choose 'Either or Survivor' (E or S) for joint FDs.

fee_decoder.name: The 1% Commission Gap
fee_decoder.insight: Agents sell 'Regular Plans' to earn ~1% commission every year from your corpus. Over 20 years, this 1% difference can reduce your final corpus by ₹20-30 Lakhs.

fee_decoder.name: Expense Ratio Impact
fee_decoder.insight: This is the annual fee deducted from your NAV. A fund with 2% expense ratio needs to generate 14% gross return just to give you 12% net.
fee_decoder.action: Compare expense ratios of similar funds. Lower is usually better for Index/Debt funds.

fee_decoder.name: Exit Load
fee_decoder.insight: A penalty for leaving early. Most equity funds charge 1% if you withdraw before 365 days.
fee_decoder.action: Do not use Equity SIPs for money needed in < 1 year. Use Liquid Funds (Zero Exit Load).

fee_decoder.name: Stamp Duty
fee_decoder.insight: A tiny government levy deducted upfront from every SIP installment.

fee_decoder.name: Arbitrage Funds (The Tax Hack)
fee_decoder.insight: Arbitrage funds are taxed as Equity (12.5% LTCG) but behave like Debt/FD (Low risk). For people in the 30% tax bracket, Arbitrage funds are far better than FDs post-tax.
fee_decoder.action: Use Arbitrage Funds for parking money for 6 months to 1 year.

tax_decoder.name: Equity STCG (< 1 Year)
tax_decoder.insight: Profit booked before 1 year is taxed heavily at 20%.
tax_decoder.strategy: Avoid redeeming equity funds before 1 year unless it's an emergency.

tax_decoder.name: Equity LTCG (> 1 Year)
tax_decoder.insight: Profits over ₹1.25 Lakh in a financial year are taxed at 12.5%.
tax_decoder.strategy: Tax Harvesting: Book profits up to ₹1.25L every year to pay zero tax, then reinvest.

tax_decoder.name: Debt Fund Taxation (Post-2023)
tax_decoder.insight: Indexation benefit is REMOVED for debt funds bought after April 1, 2023. They are now taxed exactly like FDs (at your slab rate).
tax_decoder.strategy: For long term debt allocation, SGB or PPF/EPF is now much more tax-efficient than Debt Mutual Funds.

red_flags.reason: Dividends are now fully taxable at your income slab. Growth option is much more tax-efficient.
NFOs at ₹10 NAV are not 'cheaper'. They have no track record.
red_flags.action: Stick to existing funds with >5 year track records.

red_flags.reason: BAFs charge high fees (~2%) for managing asset allocation. Often, a simple 50:50 mix of Nifty Index + Liquid Fund performs better at lower cost.

document_checklist.note: Download CAS from CAMS/KFintech once a year to see all your MF holdings in one view.
Mutual Fund folios without nominees are frozen. Check status immediately.
For SIP auto-debit. Ensure signature matches bank records to avoid rejection.
Check strictly on CVL KRA website. 'KYC Registered' is mandatory.
